ch.epfl.sdp.peakar.points

Class UserPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.sdp.peakar.points.Point
      • ch.epfl.sdp.peakar.points.UserPoint

  • public final class UserPoint
extends Point
    UserPoint is a class that represents a general point on earth. This class is a singleton: only one instance of this class is available on the entire program. It adds a component to represent the accuracy of the user's location and customLocation:
    • accuracy accuracy in meters of the user location
    • customLocation if true, the userPoint location is not updated by the GPS tracker

    It provides a constructor that takes a GPSTracker as an input. It provides a method to get updates on the user location. This class should be used as a observer that observes a GPSTracker. This class can be observed; The updates will be called only if the location changes more than MIN_DISTANCE_FOR_UPDATES meters.

      • getInstance

        public static UserPoint getInstance(android.content.Context mContext)
        Method to get the singleton instance of this class. If the class was already initialized the parameter will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        mContext - context of the application.
        Returns:
        single instance of the user point.

      • updateGPSTracker

        public void updateGPSTracker(android.content.Context mContext)

      • update

        public void update()
        Method that is used to update the current user location. It updates the observers if the point has moved more than MIN_DISTANCE_FOR_UPDATES from the last saved location.

      • getAccuracy

        public double getAccuracy()
        Getter for the accuracy.
        Returns:
        accuracy of the current location (in meters)

      • canGetLocation

        public boolean canGetLocation()
        Returns:
        true if GPSTracker is able to get the current location; false otherwise.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(double lat,
                        double lon,
                        double alt,
                        double acc)
        Method used to set custom user location
        Parameters:
        lat - user latitude (in degrees)
        lon - user longitude (in degrees)
        alt - user altitude (in meters)
        acc - user accuracy (in meters)

      • switchToRealLocation

        public void switchToRealLocation()
        Sets customLocation to false

      • isCustomLocation

        public boolean isCustomLocation()
        To check if the custom location is on
        Returns:
        true if customLocation is enabled; false otherwise.
